claim.title: Submit a claim for work related, noise-induced hearing loss
claim.fieldsMandatory: All fields are mandatory, unless marked optional
claim.continueClaim: If you are starting a new submission, please provide your email address, and we will send you a reference number. You can use this reference number to resume a partially completed form. You can resume a form in progress within 30 days.
claim.referenceNumberHint: If you’ve already started a claim, you can continue by entering your reference number.
claim.confirmationTitle: Confirm this is the correct claim form for your noise-induced hearing loss:
claim.hearingLossQuestion: Was your hearing loss gradual or sudden?
claim.gradualHearingLoss: Gradual, over a period of a few years
claim.continueEmail: Please enter a valid email address
claim.dateOfBirtherr: You must be at least 16 years old to submit a claim. Please check your date of birth.
claim.referenceNumbererr: Please enter a valid reference number
claim.Suddenlike: You have indicated that your hearing loss was sudden. You do not qualify for a noise-induced hearing loss claim,but you may still be eligible for benefits. Please submit a
claim.Gradualtitle: Gathering necessary information before starting your claim
claim.Gradualstap: This form will take you approximately 45 minutes to complete and will need the following information:
claim.Gradualstap2: Dates and locations of your hearing loss related health care appointments, including audiologists and ear nose and throat (ENT) specialists
claim.Gradualstap3: Name(s), address(es) and amount of time spent at your current and previous employers that contributed to your hearing loss
claim.Gradualstap4: List of tools and/or equipment used at each employer that contributed to your hearing loss
claim.Gradualstap6: Proof of employment documents for each relevant employer.
claim.Gradualtitle2: What if I don't have all the information?
claim.Gradualstap8: If you do not have all of the required information, please submit your claim by downloading and completing the
claim.AboutProoftitle: Uploading audiograms and proof of employment
claim.AboutProofstep1: We recommend including all of these documents in your initial claim submission because we will need them before we can make a decision on your claim. You can create a digital version of these documents by using a scanner or a camera.
claim.AboutProofstep3: We will accept pay stubs, records of employment, pension statements, award recognitions, mining cards, co-worker vouchers and previous claim documents as proof of employment.
claim.AboutProofstep4: You can ask your audiologist for your audiogram results so that you can share them with us in your claim.When you have your WSIB claim number, please ask your audiologist to electronically send us all of your audiograms.

footer.printtitle: WSIB head office: 200 Front Street West | Toronto, Ontario, Canada, M5V 3J1 | 1-800-387-0750 | TTY/ATS 1-800-387-0050 | wsib.ca

employment.saveFilesMsg: You can save your form in progress by clicking "Save" at the bottom of the page.

employment.hazardousNoiseQuestion: Do you currently work in hazardous noise conditions?
employment.previousEmployerInfo: Please provide detailed information about each of your previous employers where you worked in a noisy environment.
employment.noPreviousEmployerInfo: You have not yet provided any past employment information. Please click the 'Add' button to start adding your information.
employment.employerInBusiness: Is the Employer still in Business ?
employment.toolsUsageInfo: Tools used and hours used per day
employment.personalInsuranceWSIBQuestion: Did you have personal insurance or optional insurance provided by WSIB?
employment.selfEmployedDates: When were you self employed at your business?
employment.noisyMachineryOffwork: Have you used loud machinery, equipment, firearms, played loud music, or participated in other activities outside of work?
employment.usedNoisyMachinery: Please describe the activities you participated in and the frequency
employment.employedFromCheck: The “From” date must be before the “To” date
employment.employerToCheck: The “To” date must be after the “From” date

personalInformation.title: My information

supportingDocuments.fieldsMandatory: All fields are mandatory, unless marked optional
supportingDocuments.title: Supporting documents
supportingDocuments.supportingDocumentation: Please provide supporting documentation. Valid file types include docx, jpeg, jpg, tiff, tif, pdf.
supportingDocuments.attachAudiogramMsg: Please attach a copy of your audiogram (optional):
supportingDocuments.attachAudiogramWarning: You can proceed with this form without a copy of your audiogram, but it will be needed to support your claim.
supportingDocuments.proofMsg: We will accept pay stubs, records of employment, pension statements, award recognitions, mining cards, co-worker vouchers and previous claim documents as proof of employment.
supportingDocuments.proofMsgHeader: Please attach one proof of employment document for each employer (optional):
supportingDocuments.uploadInprogressMessage: Your files are still loading, Please try to submit again in a few moments
supportingDocuments.youMustComplete: You must complete all mandatory fields before submitting the form, but you can skip fields and return to them later.
supportingDocuments.saveAndexistMessage: If you save and exit this claim before completing it, any files you upload will not be saved.
supportingDocuments.minimizePersonalInfo: Note: When uploading supporting documents, please minimize the amount of personal information that is contained in the documents.
supportingDocuments.maxlength: You may upload only one file for each employer.The following files were not attached.
supportingDocuments.maxlengthReached: You may upload only one file for each employer.
supportingDocuments.maxlength50: You can upload up to 50 employments. If there are additional employments that you wish to submit, please upload them through our online services after you have received your claim number.
supportingDocuments.file: You have uploaded an invalid file type. Valid file types are: docx, jpeg, jpg, pdf, tiff, tif.
supportingDocuments.name: File name is too long, enter a file name less than 255 characters
supportingDocuments.size: File size should be in between 5 kb-10 MB
supportingDocuments.max: Max of 10 files are only allowed
supportingDocuments.validation: Your file name is invalid. The file name can only contain numbers, letters and the following characters: . ( ) - _. Rename the file and upload your document again.
supportingDocuments.uploadfileerr: The following file was not attached, please try again.
supportingDocuments.uploadfileerrvirus: The document you have attached may have a virus. Please attach a different document:
supportingDocuments.uploadfileerrinfo1: If you are uploading a PDF file, save another copy of the file.
supportingDocuments.uploadfileerrinfo2: If you are uploading a scanned document, re-scan the document.
supportingDocuments.uploadfileerrinfo3: If you are uploading a photo, take a new photo.
supportingDocuments.uploadfileerrinfo4: If you are still having trouble, please call us at 1-800-387-0750, Monday to Friday 7:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.
supportingDocuments.maxfileupload: You can upload up to 10 audiograms. If there are additional audiograms that you wish to submit, please upload them through our online services after you have received your claim number.
supportingDocuments.lesssize: The following file was not attached because it is below the minimum file size of 5 KB per file.
supportingDocuments.greatersize: The following file was not attached because it has exceeded the maximum limit of 10 MB per file. Please upload a smaller file:

review.title: Review
review.emailConfirmationLabel: If you would like an email confirmation that your claim has been submitted, please provide your email address. (optional)
review.declarationLine1: I am claiming benefits under the Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997, for a work-related injury/illness;and
review.declarationLine2: I authorize any health professional who treats me to provide me, my employer and the WSIB with information about my functional abilities on WSIB’s “Functional Abilities Form for Early and Safe Return to Work”; and
review.declarationLine3: I consent to allowing the WSIB to disclose my Social Insurance Number to my previous employers, if necessary, for the purpose of confirming my past employment.
review.declarationLine4: I declare all of the above information is true and correct.
review.signatureLabel: By signing below, I agree with all of the above statements
review.workplace: The Workplace Safety and Insurance Act requires you to give a copy of this form to the last employer where you worked in the process or exposures that may have caused your current illness.:
review.infoProtectionLabel: Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Provisions
review.infoProtectionP1: Personal information about you will be collected throughout your claim under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act and will be used to administer the Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997, your claim and programs of the Board. Medical and non-medical information is collected from health care providers, vocational agencies, labour market service providers, employers, witnesses, and others as required. Your Social Insurance Number is used to register claims, identify workers and to issue income tax receipts and collected under authority of the Income Tax Act. Information may only be disclosed to the employer, external medical, vocational, and safety agencies, external payment and service providers, researchers, and others as authorized by the Workplace Safety and Insurance Act and the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act. Your name and telephone number may be disclosed to third party researchers conducting satisfaction surveys and focus groups. Questions should be directed to the decision maker responsible for your file.
review.infoProtectionBeforeLink: A more detailed Privacy Statement for workers may be found at
